https://www.linkedin.com/company/startup.text:
This landmark Free Trade Agreement with the UK is a monumental step forward for India's global economic aspirations. It clearly reflects a strategic vision that will significantly open doors for our industries, from manufacturing to MSMEs, by ensuring unparalleled market access. I am confident this agreement will be a powerful engine for job creation, promoting unprecedented growth and strengthening our trade ties with the UK: Ms Monica Malhotra Kandhari, Co-Chair, FICCI Publishing Committee & Managing Director, MBD Group.

#IndiaUKFTA 

Piyush Goyal Ministry of Commerce and Industry, Government of India

The eagerly awaited India UK FTA has opened the doors for both countries to benefit. It is the culmination of prolonged discussions involving the Hon'ble Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and the Hon'ble Finance Minister Ministry of Finance and  key persons in MEA and DPIIT among many others. CII CII4MSME too had the opportunity to provide many inputs keeping in sight the opportunities for MSMEs to benefit from easier and freer exchange of goods, services, and personnel. It is fitting that the Prime Ministers of India, Mr Narendra Modi,  and Mr Keir Starmer personally signed and endorsed the FTA. We now look forward to Indian Industry taking all steps to benefit from the opportunities that it has uncovered.

CII commends the Government of India for entering into this transformative economic treaty with the UK. This FTA with one of the world’s largest economies will improve market access for our employment-intensive sectors such as agriculture, marine products, textiles and gems & jewellery. – Rajiv Memani, President CII on #IndiaUKFTA signed today

#CII4IndiaUK #IndiaUK #indiauktradeagreement

Narendra Modi Keir Starmer Piyush Goyal Nirmala Sitharaman British High Commission in India CII International EY

By July 2, 2025, we've already used up a year's worth of Earth’s resources. From now till December, we're living in an ecological deficit and borrowing from the future. 

But together, we can #MoveTheDate 📅 

💡 At IKP Knowledge Park, we support startups driving sustainability through innovation — across the planet, our cities, energy systems, food supply, and population wellbeing. Explore five key areas where change is possible — and essential.

👉 Are you a startup building a planet-positive future? Write to us at engage@ikpknowledgepark.com 

🌏 Learn more about Earth Overshoot Day: https://lnkd.in/d-PQYyjq

We are proud to be fostering several next gen deep-science based innovative solutions and research that are bridging critical gaps in healthcare, agriculture and environment

Some of these include

🧪Replacing chemical pesticides with biologicals, boosting crop productivity and farmer incomes, and increasing food security

And, much more!

#TechnologyForLicensing 
We are looking for industry partners to scale up a novel immunomodulator in the respiratory infection space.

Developed and translated by the CCAMP translation research programme, Respi-Protect helps to prevent and treat respiratory infections such as the flu and COVID-19 through intranasal delivery. 

𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐩𝐢-𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐭'𝐬 𝐔𝐒𝐏: A non-invasive, easily deliverable option for the prevention and treatment of various respiratory infections.  

𝐖𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐢𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐲? It is an immunomodulatory peptide-based immune-boosting mechanism with broad-spectrum activity against viruses like Influenza and potentially SARS-CoV-2

𝐇𝐨𝐰 𝐝𝐨𝐞𝐬 𝐢𝐭 𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐤? Respi-Protect works by activating the innate immune system in the nasal mucosa, which is the initial entry point for respiratory pathogens. This activation is achieved by modulating the TLR2/4 pathways.  

Studies conducted on animal models of influenza and COVID-19 have shown that Respi-Protect can serve both prophylactically and therapeutically, reducing lung damage and viral titers.  

We invite #industry partners and other interested stakeholders to explore partnership opportunities with us. If you are interested in knowing more about this technology, please reach out to the CCAMP Office of Technology Transfer (#OTT):   

𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐮𝐬:
📧 ott@ccamp.res.in, dia_licensing@ccamp.res.in 
☎️ 080 6718 5322

Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) Siemens Healthineers Boehringer Ingelheim Novartis Novartis India Biogen Eli Lilly and Company Aurigene Pharmaceutical Services Limited Sanofi Sanofi India Ltd Cipla Zydus Group Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India Department of Biotechnology Department of Science & Technology, Government of India

🌟 Congratulations to Deep Algorithms Solutions on raising ₹10.8 Cr (approx. $1.25M) in Seed Funding led by Unicorn India Ventures! 🌟

We are proud to share that Deep Algorithms Solutions, one of our incubated portfolio startups at IIT Mandi Catalyst, has successfully raised ₹10.8 crore ($1.25 million) in a seed funding round led by Unicorn India Ventures, with participation from several esteemed angel investors.

Founded by J P Mishra in December 2021, Deep Algorithms Solutions is a pioneering behavioral cybersecurity and AI startup committed to tackling sophisticated cyber fraud. The startup leverages indigenous AI and behavioral intelligence to address critical challenges in digital identity security and real-time application protection.

This milestone funding reinforces confidence in their vision and the impactful problem they are solving — Identity Security and Real-Time Application Security powered by AI and Behavioral Intelligence.

💥 More power to the team as they continue to innovate and protect the digital world!

Manish Parganiha | Amit Shukla | David Smith

Startup Exploration Program – designed to help you transition from prototype to a validated, market-ready solution.

If you're an innovator seeking structured guidance, expert mentorship, and access to a thriving ecosystem—this program is made for you!

✨ Here’s what you’ll gain from the program:

✅ Expert Mentorship & Capacity Building: Personalized guidance from seasoned entrepreneurs, domain experts, and industry leaders.

💡 Are you building the future of AI?
 The NCIIPC Startup India AI Grand Challenge is now open for applications!

🚀 Calling all #DeepTech innovators, #AI startups, and student entrepreneurs — here’s your chance to develop cutting-edge AI solutions for India's critical national infrastructure.

🔍𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁’𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗲 𝗔𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁?
This multi-stage competition invites startups and student groups to develop AI-driven solutions across 12 critical problem statements — ranging from phishing detection and satellite imagery analysis to multilingual document digitization and underwater acoustic data interpretation.

🔍 Key Focus Areas:
 🔹 National Security & Forensics
 🔹 AI in Big Data Analytics
 🔹 Maritime & OSINT Domain
 🔹 Geospatial Intelligence
 🔹 Cryptology

🏆 What’s in it for startups?
 ✅ ₹22.56 Cr in total prize/development grants
 ✅ ₹1.88 Cr prize money per Problem Statement
 ✅ Mentorship from top domain experts
 ✅ Access to exclusive datasets & computing infrastructure
 ✅ On-premise incubation facilities
 ✅ Post-challenge contracts on nomination basis

🎯 Win at Every Stage
 🥇 Stage 1: ₹5.76 Cr
 🥈 Stage 2: ₹10.8 Cr
 🥉 Stage 3: ₹6 Cr

📅 Don’t miss this opportunity to scale your innovation for national impact.

 🔗 Learn more and apply now: https://lnkd.in/gTZyHPiR

Society for Innovation & Entrepreneurship -SINE IIT Bombay is pleased to host NCIIPC India (A unit of NTRO) and Startup India (DPIIT) for an exclusive invite only interaction on the NCIIPC Startup India AI Grand Challenge 2025.

Based on the theme “Responsible AI for National Security”, the interactive session will offer valuable insights into the challenge, its goals, and the exciting opportunities it presents for startups working at the intersection of AI and national security priorities.

Key Focus Areas:

1. Code Vulnerability and Threat Detection 
2. Signal Processing
3. Domain Awareness
4. Geospatial Technologies
5. Cryptology and Forensics
6. Intelligent Document Understanding and RAG
 
Event Details: 
Date: 25th July
Time: 4:00 PM – 5:30 PM
Venue: SINE, IIT Bombay

Learn more about the challenge: https://lnkd.in/gypt8jpU
Register Now - https://lnkd.in/dPNg7Hea

https://www.linkedin.com/company/nsrceli.text:
NSRCEL in collaboration with HABITAT INDIA recently hosted "Climate Connect: Net-Zero Buildings and Green Data Centers", this roundtable conversation brought together voices from across the ecosystem investors, innovators, architects, developers, sustainability leads, and enablers driving real action towards net-zero infrastructure and data centers.
The discussion focused on the real challenges of scaling green buildings and sustainable infrastructure from fragmented standards and financing gaps to material traceability and the need for region-specific solutions.

Key areas addressed during the roundtable included:
 🌱 Creating a standardized framework for sustainable construction
 📊 Integrating sustainability metrics into core decision-making
 🧱 Supporting climate tech startups with patient capital
 📚 Sharing open-source playbooks on materials and best practices
 🔌 Rethinking data center sustainability beyond one-size-fits-all models
 🤝 Building a collaborative, inclusive knowledge ecosystem

A key takeaway? 
The business problems cannot have policy solutions.

The roundtable closed with concrete next steps and commitments from stakeholders to drive forward real, scalable impact.

Akshatha Narayana Stuti Kakkar Ramneek Bhatia Sumeet Popli Mahesh Kanak Dhiraj Chilakapaty Aiyappa Somayanda Sriram Kuchimanchi
Sarah Jacob Kunjpreet Arora Samhita R Abhijit Paul Zacharia Dr. Sunita Purushottam Karthik Chandrasekar

akarsh singh Akshay Joshi Nihal Choudyal Nanao Rajkumari Ashish Sahu Smriti Rai Parvathy A Manika Gulati

📊 Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! 💡

🙏 We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

🕴 The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

🪞 From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 ✅ Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 ✅ The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 ✅ Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 ✅ Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | MeitY Startup Hub | Pankaj Anand | Startup Karnataka | Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) |

Bio-innovation & startup landscapes
Design thinking

Grant writing & pitching fundamentals

🌱 The energy was contagious. The ideas? Even better. Here's to a new wave of student-led bio-entrepreneurship in India!

As India’s agriculture sector grapples with climate uncertainty, water stress, and rising input costs, the need for resilient, scalable innovations has never been more urgent.  

Krishi Mangal, an initiative by Social Alpha and Cisco CSR, is looking for start-ups working to shape the future of agriculture. 

Now in its third edition, Krishi Mangal invites applications from start-ups developing affordable, scalable, and field-validated technologies that strengthen India’s agricultural resilience.  

The program is open to innovations solving for Integrated Farming Management, Soil Rejuvenation and Irrigation Management, Farm Mechanisation, Post-Harvest Management, and Livestock Waste Management.  

Applications close on 13th July 2025. Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture #FarmersDeserveDeepTech

India’s livestock sector is growing—but so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities. 
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped value—from clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

We’re inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputs 
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systems 
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmers 
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025. Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #LivestockWasteInnovation #CircularEconomy #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

From Hubballi to the Heart of Bharat: Deshpande Startups is redefining grassroots innovation 🚀

Led by Manish Jaiswal, Deshpande Startups is one of India’s largest livelihood-focused incubators — proving that world-class startups can rise from tier-2 India.

💡 From climate-smart agriculture to rural fintech and women-led enterprises, their startups are solving for:
 – Sustainable livelihoods
 – Scalable rural solutions
 – Inclusive economic growth

🎓 Backed by the Deshpande Foundation, this ecosystem blends innovation, mentorship, and real-world testing — right where Bharat lives.

📍 From Hubballi to hundreds of hinterland founders, Deshpande Startups is building not just companies, but a rural startup revolution.

Ready-to-Use Labs, Offices, and Desks and much more at India's largest incubator for science and technology based startups! Come.... 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝘂𝗯𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘂𝘀!

Venture Center is an award winning, leading incubator for deeptech, knowledge intensive startups, and our 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗜𝗻𝗰𝘂𝗯𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺 for startups offers a range of benefits—without taking any equity!

1. World-Class Infrastructure

Access to state-of-the-art labs, fully equipped offices, and flexible desks. Our facilities are designed to meet the diverse needs of startups, providing everything you need to innovate and grow.

2. Expert Mentorship and Guidance

24/7 access to in-house expertise, in addition to customized one-on-one mentoring from industry veterans. 

3. Funding Opportunities

Access to seed funds, CSR funds, and government grants for different stages of your journey.

4. Prime Location

We are based in Pune, a city known for its thriving tech and innovation scene, and we are in close proximity to prestigious educational institutions and research centers. 

5. Comprehensive Ecosystem

Our extensive support network includes legal assistance, business development resources, regulatory and IP support, and access to workshops and events that provide valuable insights and networking opportunities. 

6. Vibrant peer group community on our campus

Surround yourself with like-minded innovators and entrepreneurs who can inspire and support your startup journey. 

𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗰𝘁 𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆! We're looking for startups with an innovative idea or technology in the early stages with a scalable business model!

Drug testing is evolving, and so are the tools behind it. With the FDA Modernization Acts 2.0 and 3.0, regulators are opening the door to more advanced, human-relevant approaches to testing.

From bio-printed tissue models to organ-on-chip platforms and AI-powered simulations, today’s New Approach Methodologies (NAMs) are helping researchers develop safer, more precise treatments, while reducing dependence on animal models.

𝗪𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲? Connect with the Venture Center team to learn how we can support you. Contact Manish Gore, Ph.D.  at: manish.gore@venturecenter.co.in

Premnath Venugopalan Mrunal K. Smita Kale BIRAC Regional Bioinnovation Center (BRBC)

Congratulations to VentureStudio incubatee RenewCred and founder Abhimanyu Rathi on receiving ACT’s pre-MVP grant! We’re also thrilled to see RenewCred featured in Entrepreneur India.

RenewCred is building India’s first tech-led carbon credit registry - enabling small and mid-sized climate actors to generate high-quality carbon credits through a digital MRV platform that’s faster, cheaper, and science-led. By using IoT, blockchain, and machine learning, they are making India’s voluntary carbon market more inclusive and scalable. 

We’re proud to support their journey in shaping India’s climate infrastructure from the ground up.

#ClimateTech #CarbonCredits #SocialInnovation #Sustainability #StartupIndia

🚨 Startup Tip No. 2: Validate before you build

Got an app idea? A new product in mind?

Pause.

Before building anything, talk to 50 people.
✓ Understand their problems
✓ Learn how they currently solve it
✓ Ask if they'd pay for your solution

Your first milestone isn’t a prototype; it’s real conversations.

At VentureStudio, too many founders skip this step and build in the dark.

Validation saves you months of rework and regret.

Talk first. Build later.

#StartupTips #ValidateBeforeYouBuild #EarlyStageStartups #ProductValidation #CustomerDiscovery #VentureStudio #BuildSmart #StartupAdvice #FounderJourney

https://www.linkedin.com/company/icreate.text:
Designing the Future: Smarter, Faster, Simulation-Driven

As part of the #ProtoQuik Launchpad Cohort 1, we hosted an in-depth session with experts from SOLIDWORKS and 3DEXPERIENCE Works, facilitated by Best Engineering Aids & Consultancies (BEACON India) — empowering Robotics innovators with a hands-on understanding of modern design and simulation workflows.

The session began with an introduction by Swapnil Barot, Regional Head – Gujarat at BEACON India. This was followed by Ronak Kamani, who demonstrated how to build smarter and faster products using SOLIDWORKS.
The second half featured an advanced discussion on simulation-driven design—including FEA, CFD, and EMAG—led by Theophilus Dsouza and Venkatesh S S, helping participants explore how virtual testing and optimisation can significantly reduce development time and risk.

For the ProtoQuik Robotics cohort, it was a deep dive into building better, smarter, and more resilient systems—starting from the digital workspace.

We’re proud to share that FaceIntel Technologies, an iCreate-supported startup, is making headlines for its impactful deployment in public safety during the Bonalu festival at the Mahakali Temple, Hyderabad.

Faced with 40,000–50,000 daily footfalls, the Telangana Police Department entrusted FaceIntel’s real-time crowd monitoring solution to ensure smooth flow and safety. Their AI-powered system is based on cutting-edge face-recognition technology that is scalable to 1000+ recognitions per minute with 98%+ accuracy. It tracks 'People In and Out' and instantly alerts the control room when thresholds are breached—preventing stampede-like situations before they happen.

👏 The success of this deployment has been officially appreciated by the Commissioner of Police, Hyderabad—a proud milestone for FaceIntel Technologies and for all of us at iCreate!

Behind this impactful innovation are founders Rajesh kandlagunta and Dr Akhil Gurram, Ph.D., whose vision and tech-led approach are transforming public safety infrastructure.

This is innovation in action—where Deep Tech meets real-world problem-solving.
- Powered by: FaceIntel Technologies
- In collaboration with: Telangana Police Department
- Supported by: iCreate – India’s leading startup incubator for tech innovation
